meanings.definition: Having a relatively great extent from one surface or side to the opposite; not thin.
meanings.sent1: The blanket was thick and warm, perfect for a cold night.
meanings.sent2: The tree trunk was thick and sturdy, providing ample shade.
meanings.sent3: The plot of the movie was so thick with twists and turns that it kept me guessing till the end.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, you could cut it with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick that I could barely see my own hand in front of me.

meanings.definition: Measuring a certain number of units in this dimension.
meanings.sent1: The book was so thick, it took me a while to finish reading it.
meanings.sent2: The sandwich was thick with layers of cheese and ham.
meanings.sent3: The traffic on the road was as thick as molasses, making the journey slow.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, you could cut it with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick that I could barely see my own hand in front of me.

meanings.definition: Having a dense or viscous consistency.
meanings.sent1: The paint was so thick that it took longer to dry.
meanings.sent2: The soup was thick and hearty, perfect for a cold day.
meanings.sent3: The traffic on the road was as thick as molasses, making the journey slow.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, you could cut it with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick that I could barely see my own hand in front of me.

meanings.sent1: The tension in the room was so thick, you could cut it with a knife.
meanings.sent2: The air was thick with the smell of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent3: The soup was so thick with flavor that it was irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the stadium was so thick, you could feel it in the air.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was so thick, you could cut it with a knife.

meanings.definition: Not easily understood; dense in meaning.
meanings.sent1: The novel had a thick plot that kept me engaged throughout.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture was so thick with information that I had to take notes quickly.
meanings.sent3: The traffic on the road was as thick as molasses, making the journey slow.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, you could cut it with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick that I could barely see my own hand in front of me.
